author: Jamie Bullen
title: Asda Clapham sparks fierce debate after move to stock ketchup in fridge
text:
Tuesday 7 February 2017 22:42 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Debate: Asda Clapham will start stocking ketchup in the fridge following a fierce debate about where to store it Getty Images 
A south London supermarket has started storing ketchup in the fridge amid a fierce debate on social media about where to keep the condiment. 
Twitter users have reacted in a frenzy following an argument whether it was best to place ketchup in a fridge or in a cupboard. 
And now Asda declared it had “joined the ketchup debate” by stocking its own brand on shelves and in fridges at its superstore near Clapham Junction station. 
The supermarket tweeted: “Where do you keep your tomato ketchup? Our colleagues at Asda Clapham have joined the debate by stocking them on shelves AND in the fridge.” Where do you keep your tomato ketchup? Our colleagues at Asda Clapham have joined the debate by stocking them on shelves AND in the fridge. — Asda (@asda) 7 February 2017 
More than 2,000 votes have been cast in a Twitter poll with cupboard narrowly ahead on 54 per cent with 14 hours to go until it closed. 
Asda's Victoria Williams told the Daily Mail : “Tomato ketchup is a staple of many of our customers weekly shop but recent debate has prompted us to trial two areas to stock our great value own brand tomato ketchup sauces, so we can end the debate once and for all and give everyone what they want.” Read more
